data.text:
Discover a historic gem at North Bend Plantation, a Virginia B&B built in 1801. Immerse in Southern hospitality, explore Civil War history and enjoy modern amenities. Book your stay now by calling our B&B hostess!

Discover the rich history of North Bend Plantation, a Federal Period Greek Revival-style home built in 1801. From its origins as the residence of John Minge and his wife Sarah Harrison, sister to President William Henry Harrison, to its pivotal role during the Civil War as Union General Phillip Sheridan’s headquarters, North Bend unfolds stories of resilience and change. Learn more about the plantation’s remarkable journey through time and explore its well-preserved grounds.

Experience Southern hospitality at North Bend, a spacious 6,000 square-foot Virginia Historic Landmark and National Register. Choose from three large guest rooms and a double room suite, each with a private on-suite bathroom. Immerse yourself in the charm of the plantation, featuring saltwater swimming pool, original billiards table, and elegantly decorated interiors. Wake up to a full country breakfast served in the Dining Room. Your stay at North Bend is not just accommodation; it’s a journey through time.

The Sheridan Room

This stately room features a grand queen-sized bed with a wood-framed canopy. Embedded with Civil War history, the bed was hit with a cannon ball, now fully restored. The private bath includes a shower.

THE MAGNOLIA ROOM

North Bend’s two-room suite with a shared bath. Each room has a private entrance to the room and a shared bath in between.

THE ROSE ROOM

A beautiful spacious bed chamber featuring a King bed and an antique armoire with a diamond dust mirror in the center. The private bath includes a shower.

Indulge in the comfort of spacious bed chambers at North Bend, each adorned with antique armories, period antiques, and private baths. Explore the unique charm of The Federal Room, steeped in the plantation’s Federal period, or The Sheridan Room, which boasts a grand queen-sized bed with a history tied to the Civil War. Discover the beauty of The Rose Room and The Magnolia Suite, each offering a distinctive and cozy retreat.

Experience gracious Southern hospitality at North Bend Plantation, offering a range of amenities such as billiards, a piano, and three inviting porches. Explore nearby attractions like the Capital Bike Trail or other James River Plantations. Unwind by the outdoor saltwater pool and revel in the tranquility of North Bend’s grounds. At this peaceful retreat time seems to slow down, making this the perfect escape.

Embark on a self-guided tour of North Bend’s historical structures, including the Smoke House, Dairy House, Old Well, Ice House, and the Slave Quarter Site. Delve into the history of North Bend and its people through private guided house tours, showcasing its rich heritage and ties to the Civil War.
